title: China to Let Power Prices Rise in Bid to Fix Electricity Crunch
sub_head: Shortage has slowed factory output, hitting companies around the world
body:
China said it would allow the price of coal-fired power to rise more sharply, in the hope that market forces can address a power crunch that has threatened growth and caused ripple effects around the world.
The decision by the governmentâ€™s economic-planning arm amounted to an acknowledgment that price controls have warped the market. Power producers have been hit with sharply rising costs for the coal they need to fire their generators, yet government rules have largely prevented them from passing on those higher costs to their customers.
